title: the compiler unexpectedly panicked with message "no type for node"

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc bug.rs

```
error: internal compiler error: no type for node 17: pat _ (id=17) in fcx 0x7ff96bbf0100
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
```

$ cat bug.rs

```
fn main() {
    let value = 1;

    match SomeStruct(value) {
        StructConst1(_) => { },
        _ => { },
    }

    struct SomeStruct(u8);

    const StructConst1 : SomeStruct = SomeStruct(1);
    const StructConst2 : SomeStruct = SomeStruct(2);
}
```
